Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support its assertion that the cleaners in the photos are the "unsung heroes" of Hong Kong.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos were taken before the 2019 pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the cleaners by calling them "cleaner bees" and implying that they work more efficiently than cleaners in other parts of the world.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the "future pillar of our society" (presumably referring to the pro-democracy protesters) are causing damage and leaving the cleaners to clean up after them, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the presence of the cleaners in the photos, such as regular street cleaning or unrelated events, which the claim fails to consider.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the photos by misleadingly portraying them as depicting the aftermath of the pro-democracy protests, when in fact they were taken before the protests began.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information and failing to provide accurate context for the photos.
